text.p: Suppose [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] is a [mathjaxinline]4\times 3[/mathjaxinline] matrix, and [mathjaxinline]B[/mathjaxinline] is an [mathjaxinline]3 \times 5[/mathjaxinline] matrix, so that [mathjaxinline]AB[/mathjaxinline] is a [mathjaxinline]4\times 5[/mathjaxinline] matrix.
Which of the following matrix products is defined?

font.p: [mathjaxinline]A^ t[/mathjaxinline] is a [mathjaxinline]3\times 4[/mathjaxinline] matrix, and [mathjaxinline]B^ t[/mathjaxinline] is a [mathjaxinline]5 \times 3[/mathjaxinline] matrix. For the product to be defined, the first matrix must have as many columns as the second matrix has rows. This is true in one arrangement, but not the other.
